page.title: 14Transport in the Country
page.content: As there is no public transport in the area now, apart from the railway station at Amberley, most families are dependant on their car for getting to work, shopping and visiting family and friends. Children are taken to school by bus or by their parents in cars. A few people use bicycles for local visits but those without cars use the community mini bus to take them into the nearby town of Storrington for shopping. From there it is possible to get a bus into the larger towns of Worthing and Chichester. Trains run from Amberley Station or Pulborough, to and from London but cross country journeys can be achieved with some difficulty.
